abstract.p: Injury sidelines New York Islanders' Bill Muckalt (S)

block.p: The Islanders departed for tonight's game in Atlanta in search of a victory and without wing Bill Muckalt, who will be out four to six weeks with a dislocated right shoulder sustained in the loss to Anaheim on Tuesday.
A magnetic resonance imaging examination on Wednesday revealed the extent of the injury to Muckalt, who injured his left shoulder last season.

The Islanders departed for tonight's game in Atlanta in search of a victory and without wing Bill Muckalt, who will be out four to six weeks with a dislocated right shoulder sustained in the loss to Anaheim on Tuesday.
A magnetic resonance imaging examination on Wednesday revealed the extent of the injury to Muckalt, who injured his left shoulder last season.

Muckalt was acquired from Vancouver last December and played in 12 games for the Islanders last season before missing the final 40 games after undergoing surgery to repair the dislocated left shoulder. Replacing him on the roster will be Jeff Toms, a 6-foot-5, 205-pound forward. He played at Springfield, where he led the American Hockey League club in points with 11 in five games.
